answers.author: Jeffrey French
answers.text:
Angel, the Wisconsin Dept of Natural Resources provides a resource guide for Wisconsin Municipalities if you log onto the DNR web site and then search for Emerald Ash Borer you can access this document
http://dnr.wi.gov/topic/urbanforests/eab.html
Hope this helps.

answers.author: Robert Kiely
answers.text:
Angel, in Lake Forest, IL we are in the plan development and public information phase. We just completed establishing an environmental leadership consortium with a local land trust, local public schools and Lake Forest College to make our efforts regional and comprehensive. Our main contact person is Chuck Myer, MyersC@cityoflakeforest.com.
He would be happy to share thoughts and ideas with you.


Angel, in Lake Forest, IL we are in the plan development and public information phase. answers.author: Teresa McDill
answers.text:
Hi Angel, our website in Minnesota may help, too.  It was developed through a grant from the legislature in 2010 to help with Community Preparedness for EAB:
http://www.mda.state.mn.us/grants/grants/fprappropriation/eaboutreach.aspx 
Contact me if you have questions--651-201-6448. Thank you!


Hi Angel, our website in Minnesota may help, too.  It was developed through a grant from the legislature in 2010 to help with Community Preparedness for EAB:

Contact me if you have questions--651-201-6448. Thank you!

author: Angel Smith
text:
Hello! 
I am currently conducting research for the City of North Oaks, MN regarding EAB Planning Process/Education. I am interested in hearing from any municipality who currently has a management planning process in place. This process could also include a plan for educating citizens about EAB. Please contact me via email at Angel_R_Smith@yahoo.com. 
Thank you, 
Angel Smith 
407-617-7271
title: Emerald Ash Borer (EAB) Planning Process/Education
